data.chText: 保证；诺言；誓约
data.enText: a serious promise

data.chText: 支援的许诺
data.enText: a pledge of support

data.chText: 政府会履行它的竞选诺言，不增加税收吗？
data.enText: Will the government honour its election pledge not to raise taxes?

data.chText: 资方保证今年不会削减工作职位。
data.enText: Management has given a pledge that there will be no job losses this year.

data.chText: 抵押；质钱；抵押品
data.enText: a sum of money or sth valuable that you leave with sb to prove that you will do sth or pay back money that you owe
sign/take the pledge

data.chText: 发誓戒酒
data.enText: to make a promise never to drink alcohol

data.chText: 保证给予（或做）；正式承诺
data.enText: to formally promise to give or do sth

data.chText: 日本已承诺提供一亿元人道主义援助。
data.enText: Japan has pledged $100 million in humanitarian aid.

data.chText: 政府保证支持这项计划。
data.enText: The government pledged their support for the plan.

data.chText: 我们都必须对国旗宣誓效忠。
data.enText: We all had to pledge allegiance to the flag (= state that we are loyal to our country) .

data.chText: 这个组织发誓继续投入运动。
data.enText: The group has pledged to continue campaigning.

data.chText: 这个组织发誓他们将继续投入运动。
data.enText: The group has pledged that they will continue campaigning.

data.chText: 使保证；使发誓
data.enText: to make sb or yourself formally promise to do sth

data.chText: 他们都宣誓保密。
data.enText: They were all pledged to secrecy.

data.chText: 政府已承诺铲除腐败。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The government has pledged itself to root out corruption.

data.chText: 抵押；典当
data.enText: to leave sth with sb as a pledge(2)

data.chText: 宣誓参加美国大学生联谊会
data.enText: to promise to become a junior member of a fraternity or sorority

data.chText: 这学期你想加入大学生联谊会吗？
data.enText: Do you think you'll pledge this semester?

data.chText: 我哥哥宣誓加入Σ NU联谊会。
data.enText: My brother pledged Sigma Nu.

word_means: 宣誓参加美国大学生联谊会

means: 宣誓参加美国大学生联谊会

ex.chText: 当地政府保证决不向恐怖分子妥协。
ex.enText: The local government made a pledge to not compromise with terrorists.

ex.chText: 他履行竞选时的承诺了吗？
ex.enText: Has he fulfilled his election pledge?

synonyms.bx: 尤指公开或正式作出的保证。

ex.chText: 经过我再三保证，她看起来不那么紧张了。
ex.enText: After my repeated assurances, she looked less worried.

ex.chText: 裁缝保证周五之前把她的裙子做好。
ex.enText: The tailor gave an assurance that her dress would be ready by Friday.

synonyms.bx: 指强调某事一定会发生或肯定某事真实性的保证，尤为减轻他人的忧虑。

ex.chText: 经理已经保证不会裁员。
ex.enText: The manager has given a guarantee that there will be no redundancies.

ex.chText: 实际上，即使你能得到那笔资金，也不一定会成功。
ex.enText: Actually, there's no guarantee of success even if you can get the money.

synonyms.bx: 一般指对一定会做某事或某事肯定会发生的正式承诺。

data.enText: sign/take the pledge

data.chText: 发誓戒酒
data.enText: to make a promise never to drink alcohol

tr: a binding commitment to do or give or refrain from something
example: an assurance of help when needed
signed a pledge never to reveal the secret

tr: a drink in honor of or to the health of a person or event
someone accepted for membership but not yet fully admitted to the group
a deposit of personal property as security for a debt

example: I pledge that I will honor my wife

tr: bind or secure by a pledge

example: Let us toast the birthday girl!
Let's drink to the New Year

tr: pay (an amount of money) as a contribution to a charity or service, especially at regular intervals
example: I pledged $10 a month to my favorite radio station

value.def: When someone makes a pledge, they make a serious promise that they will do something.

example.ex: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
example.tran: 会议以承诺加快这一地区六国间的合作而结束。

example.ex: ...a £1.1m pledge of support from the Spanish ministry of culture.
example.tran: 来自西班牙文化部110万英镑的资助许诺

value.def: When someone pledges to do something, they promise in a serious way to do it. When they pledge something, they promise to give it.

example.ex: Mr Dudley has pledged to give any award to charity...
example.tran: 达德利先生已承诺将任何所获的损害赔偿额都捐给慈善机构。

example.ex: Philip pledges support and offers to help in any way that he can...
example.tran: 菲利普保证给予支持，并主动提出尽其所能提供帮助。

example.ex: I pledge that by next year we will have the problem solved.
example.tran: 我保证来年之前我们将解决这个问题。

value.tran: 保证，许诺，发誓（做）；保证给予

value.def: If you pledge a sum of money to an organization or activity, you promise to pay that amount of money to it at a particular time or over a particular period.

example.ex: The French President is pledging $150 million in French aid next year...
example.tran: 法国总统许诺为法国明年的援助经费拨款1.5亿美元。

example.ex: The government has now pledged £170m over the next six years for improving primary care.
example.tran: 为了改善初级卫生保健工作，政府已承诺在未来6年内拨款1.7亿英镑。

example.ex: ...a pledge of forty two million dollars a month.
example.tran: 每月拨款4,200万美元的承诺

value.def: If you pledge yourself to something, you commit yourself to following a particular course of action or to supporting a particular person, group, or idea.

example.ex: The President pledged himself to increase taxes for the rich but not the middle classes...
example.tran: 总统保证增加对富人而非中产阶级的税收。

example.ex: Tony Cottee has pledged himself to Everton Football Club for another three years...
example.tran: 托尼·科蒂已答应同埃弗顿足球俱乐部再续约3年。

example.ex: The treaties renounce the use of force and pledge the two countries to co-operation.
example.tran: 条约声明放弃使用武力，并保证两国将进行合作。

value.tran: 使保证，使许诺，使发誓（遵循或支持）

value.def: If you pledge something such as a valuable possession or a sum of money, you leave it with someone as a guarantee that you will repay money that you have borrowed.

example.ex: He asked her to pledge the house as security for a loan.
example.tran: 他要她拿房子来抵押贷款。

trans: 效忠誓詞；宣誓；效忠誓词；效忠誓言；效忠宣誓
